body:
Your issue is probably your Python version. Try `conda install python=3.7` before executing `pip install mlfinlab`.

1) `conda create -n mlfinlab` 
2) `conda activate mlfinlab` 
3) `conda install python=3.7`
4) `pip install mlfinlab`

new error after following the above steps: 
```
Failed to build cvxpy scs
Installing collected packages: numpy, scipy, joblib, scikit-learn, future, osqp, ecos, scs, dill, multiprocess, six, cvxpy, pytz, python-dateutil, pandas, patsy, statsmodels, kiwisolver, pyparsing, cycler, matplotlib, llvmlite, numba, xmlrunner, mlfinlab
    Running setup.py install for scs ... error
```

I have seen this problem before and I think it was some miss-matched package versions, but kinda forget what the exact source for problem was. To be sure, start with a fresh conda environment and do not install any of the packages that are required by mlfinlab via any conda channel.

```zsh
(base) ➜  ~ conda create -n mlfinlab
(base) ➜  ~ conda activate mlfinlab
(mlfinlab) ➜  ~ conda install python=3.7
(mlfinlab) ➜  ~ pip install mlfinlab
```
After doing the above steps (including mlk) into a clean environment it should look like this:

Edit: I just tried installing all packages, that were available via conda and only those that are not via pip (cvxpy==1.0.25, sphinx-rtd-theme==0.4.3, statsmodels==0.11.1, xmlrunner==1.7.7). That actually also seems to work atm.
This might actually necessary, to get mkl enabled numpy etc.

I'm still having issues. It was a fresh environment and I only used pip to install. If you can, can you show me the commands that worked for you?

> ```shell
> (base) ➜  ~ conda create -n mlfinlab
> (base) ➜  ~ conda activate mlfinlab
> (mlfinlab) ➜  ~ conda install python=3.7
> (mlfinlab) ➜  ~ pip install mlfinlab
> ```
and
```zsh
(base) ➜  ~ conda create -n mlfinlab
(base) ➜  ~ conda activate mlfinlab
(mlfinlab) ➜  ~ conda install python=3.7
(mlfinlab) ➜  ~ conda install mkl
(mlfinlab) ➜  ~ conda install --yes --file requirements.txt # File is attached below. I commented out any package that is not available via conda (cvxpy, sphinx-rtd-theme, statsmodels, xmlrunner) or only required for the dev. environment (codecov, coverage, pylint, sphinx, sphinx-rtd-theme).
(mlfinlab) ➜  ~ pip install mlfinlab
```
Both have worked for me. 
Do you maybe have any of the required python packages installed globally (outside of anacona)?

P.S.: I also ran a few unittests to check if everything is working.
[requirements.txt](https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/mlfinlab/files/4624925/requirements.txt)

no but what finally worked for me was the following

```
(base) ➜  ~ conda create -n mlfinlab
(base) ➜  ~ conda activate mlfinlab
(mlfinlab) ➜  ~ conda install python=3.7 -c anaconda
(mlfinlab) ➜  ~ pip install mlfinlab (error generated but some stuff installed)
(mlfinlab) ->  ~ conda install cvxpy 1.0.25 -c anaconda (some stuff was conda-forge some anaconda but it worked)
(mlfinlab) -> ~ pip install mlfinlab
```
